export.hpp

00001 #ifndef BOOST_SERIALIZATION_EXPORT_HPP
00002 #define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_EXPORT_HPP
00003 
00004 // MS compatible compilers support #pragma once
00005 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1020)
00006 # pragma once
00007 #endif
00008 
00010 // export.hpp: set traits of classes to be serialized
00011 
00012 // (C) Copyright 2002 Robert Ramey - http://www.rrsd.com .
00013 // Use, modification and distribution is subject to the Boost Software
00014 // License, Version 1.0. (See accompanying file LICENSE_1_0.txt or copy at
00015 // http://www.boost.org/LICENSE_1_0.txt)
00016 
00017 //  See http://www.boost.org for updates, documentation, and revision history.
00018 
00019 // (C) Copyright 2006 David Abrahams - http://www.boost.org.
00020 // implementation of class export functionality.  This is an alternative to
00021 // "forward declaration" method to provoke instantiation of derived classes
00022 // that are to be serialized through pointers.
00023 
00024 #include <utility>
00025 #include <cstddef> // NULL
00026 
00027 #include <boost/config.hpp>
00028 #include <boost/static_assert.hpp>
00029 #include <boost/preprocessor/stringize.hpp>
00030 #include <boost/type_traits/is_polymorphic.hpp>
00031 
00032 #ifndef BOOST_SERIALIZATION_DEFAULT_TYPE_INFO   
00033     #include <boost/serialization/extended_type_info_typeid.hpp>   
00034 #endif 
00035 #include <boost/serialization/static_warning.hpp>
00036 #include <boost/serialization/type_info_implementation.hpp>
00037 #include <boost/serialization/assume_abstract.hpp>
00038 #include <boost/serialization/force_include.hpp>
00039 #include <boost/serialization/singleton.hpp>
00040 
00041 #include <boost/archive/detail/register_archive.hpp>
00042 #include <boost/mpl/assert.hpp>
00043 #include <boost/mpl/and.hpp>
00044 #include <boost/mpl/not.hpp>
00045 #include <boost/mpl/bool.hpp>
00046 
00047 #include <iostream>
00048 
00049 namespace boost {
00050 namespace archive {
00051 namespace detail {
00052 
00053 class basic_pointer_iserializer;
00054 class basic_pointer_oserializer;
00055 
00056 template<class Archive, class T>
00057 class pointer_iserializer;
00058 template<class Archive, class T>
00059 class pointer_oserializer;
00060 
00061 template <class Archive, class Serializable>
00062 struct export_impl
00063 {
00064     static const basic_pointer_iserializer &
00065     enable_load(mpl::true_){
00066         return boost::serialization::singleton<
00067             pointer_iserializer<Archive, Serializable> 
00068         >::get_const_instance();
00069     }
00070 
00071     static const basic_pointer_oserializer &
00072     enable_save(mpl::true_){
00073         return boost::serialization::singleton<
00074             pointer_oserializer<Archive, Serializable> 
00075         >::get_const_instance();
00076     }
00077     inline static void enable_load(mpl::false_) {}
00078     inline static void enable_save(mpl::false_) {}
00079 };
00080 
00081 // On many platforms, naming a specialization of this template is
00082 // enough to cause its argument to be instantiated.
00083 template <void(*)()>
00084 struct instantiate_function {};
00085 
00086 template <class Archive, class Serializable>
00087 struct ptr_serialization_support
00088 {
00089 # if defined(BOOST_MSVC) || defined(__SUNPRO_CC)
00090     virtual BOOST_DLLEXPORT void instantiate() BOOST_USED;
00091 # elif defined(__BORLANDC__)   
00092     static BOOST_DLLEXPORT void instantiate() BOOST_USED;
00093     enum { x = sizeof(instantiate(),3) };
00094 # else
00095     static BOOST_DLLEXPORT void instantiate() BOOST_USED;
00096     typedef instantiate_function<
00097         &ptr_serialization_support::instantiate
00098     > x;
00099 # endif
00100 };
00101 
00102 template <class Archive, class Serializable>
00103 BOOST_DLLEXPORT void 
00104 ptr_serialization_support<Archive,Serializable>::instantiate()
00105 {
00106     export_impl<Archive,Serializable>::enable_save(
00107         #if ! defined(__BORLANDC__)
00108         BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME 
00109         #endif
00110         Archive::is_saving()
00111     );
00112 
00113     export_impl<Archive,Serializable>::enable_load(
00114         #if ! defined(__BORLANDC__)
00115         BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME 
00116         #endif
00117         Archive::is_loading()
00118     );
00119 }
00120 
00121 namespace {
00122 
00123 template<class T>
00124 struct guid_initializer
00125 {  
00126     const guid_initializer & export_guid(char const* /* key */, mpl::false_){
00127         // generates the statically-initialized objects whose constructors
00128         // register the information allowing serialization of T objects
00129         // through pointers to their base classes.
00130         instantiate_ptr_serialization((T*)0, 0, adl_tag());
00131         return *this;
00132     }
00133     const guid_initializer & export_guid(char const* /*key*/, mpl::true_){
00134         return *this;
00135     }
00136     const guid_initializer & export_guid(char const* key){
00137         BOOST_STATIC_WARNING(boost::is_polymorphic<T>::value);
00138         assert(NULL != key);
00139         boost::serialization::singleton<
00140             BOOST_DEDUCED_TYPENAME 
00141             boost::serialization::type_info_implementation<T>::type
00142         >::get_mutable_instance().key_register(key);
00143         // note: exporting an abstract base class will have no effect
00144         // and cannot be used to instantitiate serialization code
00145         // (one might be using this in a DLL to instantiate code)
00146         //BOOST_STATIC_WARNING(! boost::serialization::is_abstract<T>::value);
00147         return export_guid(key, boost::serialization::is_abstract<T>());
00148     }
00149 };
00150 
00151 template<typename T>
00152 struct init_guid;
00153 
00154 } // anonymous
00155 } // namespace detail
00156 } // namespace archive
00157 } // namespace boost
00158 
00159 #define BOOST_CLASS_EXPORT_GUID(T, K)                                  \
00160     namespace boost {                                                  \
00161     namespace archive {                                                \
00162     namespace detail {                                                 \
00163     namespace {                                                        \
00164     template<>                                                         \
00165     struct init_guid< T > {                                            \
00166         static ::boost::archive::detail::guid_initializer< T > const   \
00167             & guid_initializer;                                        \
00168     };                                                                 \
00169     ::boost::archive::detail::guid_initializer< T > const &            \
00170         ::boost::archive::detail::init_guid< T >::guid_initializer =   \
00171            ::boost::serialization::singleton<                          \
00172                ::boost::archive::detail::guid_initializer< T >         \
00173            >::get_mutable_instance().export_guid(K);                   \
00174     }}}}                                                                \
00175 
00176 
00177 #if BOOST_WORKAROUND(__MWERKS__, BOOST_TESTED_AT(0x3205))
00178 
00179 // CodeWarrior fails to construct static members of class templates
00180 // when they are instantiated from within templates, so on that
00181 // compiler we ask users to specifically register base/derived class
00182 // relationships for exported classes.  On all other compilers, use of
00183 // this macro is entirely optional.
00184 # define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_MWERKS_BASE_AND_DERIVED(Base,Derived)                  \
00185 namespace {                                                                         \
00186   static int BOOST_PP_CAT(boost_serialization_mwerks_init_, __LINE__) =             \
00187   (::boost::archive::detail::instantiate_ptr_serialization((Derived*)0,0), 3);      \
00188   static int BOOST_PP_CAT(boost_serialization_mwerks_init2_, __LINE__) = (          \
00189       ::boost::serialization::void_cast_register((Derived*)0,(Base*)0)              \
00190     , 3);                                                                           \
00191 }
00192 
00193 #else
00194 
00195 # define BOOST_SERIALIZATION_MWERKS_BASE_AND_DERIVED(Base,Derived)
00196 
00197 #endif 
00198 
00199 // check for unnecessary export.  T isn't polymorphic so there is no
00200 // need to export it.
00201 #define BOOST_CLASS_EXPORT_CHECK(T)                              \
00202     BOOST_STATIC_WARNING(                                        \
00203         boost::is_polymorphic<U>::value                          \
00204     );                                                           \
00205     
00206 
00207 // the default exportable class identifier is the class name
00208 // the default list of archives types for which code id generated
00209 // are the originally included with this serialization system
00210 #define BOOST_CLASS_EXPORT(T)                   \
00211     BOOST_CLASS_EXPORT_GUID(                    \
00212         T,                                      \
00213         BOOST_PP_STRINGIZE(T)                   \
00214     )                                           \
00215     
00216 
00217 #endif // BOOST_SERIALIZATION_EXPORT_HPP
